Anze Kopitar is the Kings leading scorer for the 14th time.

The 14 times are the most by any player in franchise history.

He joins Gordie Howe (17 times) as the only two players in NHL history to lead the same team in points at least 14 times. https://t.co/dV7ohcVzZz

On April 30, 2014, the @LAKings became the fourth team in NHL history to win a Best-of-7 series after facing a 3-0 series deficit. Jonathan Quick made 39 saves, and Anze Kopitar scored the game-winning goal in a 5-1 win in Game 7 versus the San Jose Sharks.

On April 30, 2012, Jeff Carter scored his first playoff goal as a member of the @LAKings. Anze Kopitar scored two goals, and Dustin Brown recorded three assists in a 5-2 win over the St. Louis Blues in Game 2 of the Western Conference Semifinals.
